stories.text:
Software Engineers in Australia are cheap, and of good quality ($100k for good senior dev as opposed to $300 in the US). Australia is one of the best countries in APAC attracting talents from Singapore, New Zealand, Malaysia, India and China.

Really hope more interesting tech companies can open office in Australia. It's a good deal!

If you can open office in Melbourne it will be the best :)

Just me dreaming about working for good companies in this corner of the world.
stories.title: Software companies please hire more in Australia!
Nzyme v1.2.0 has been released (Open WiFi Defense System)
Heat waves, tropical nights increase in N. Korea due to global warming

stories.text:
I need Chrome + Safari + Firefox centralized in one browser so that I can switch tab instead of screen, does it exist?
If not, I would be curious about knowing if this is technically possible
stories.title: Chrome and Safari and Firefox in one browser
Microsoft Seizes 42 Websites from Chinese Hacking Group

stories.text:
Hello! All,

I am tackling some product ideas and wondering if you can help me.

It's just a bit of my hobby to tinker around with products, those who carry too many photos in their smartphones - and then they have Google Photos, iCloud, Amazon Photos, Flickr, Facebook, Instagram OneDrive, or Dropbox. And all those services have "auto-sync" set up on your phone.

Then how do you manage those photos? Ever wish to see all your photos from everywhere onto one platform?

Help me answer those questions, and if you have any other questions that you think I should be thinking - love to get your help!

Please visit this link to take to get early access and answer a few of our questions https://brnr.cc/8a5656d0

#Photos #Smartphones #Services #OneDrive #GoogleDrive #OneDrive #Dropbox #Flickr #AmazonPhotos #instagram #amazon #facebook #help #google #love
stories.title: How many places have you stored your photos? (iCloud, Google Photos etc.)
